summary: This document details an investigation by Special Agent Martin Woods regarding an attempt to serve target letters to two females on Jeffrey Epstein's private plane at Cyril E. King Airport. The investigation involved coordination with various officials, including the Federal Security Director and Customs and Border Protection, to delay the flight and serve the targets, but ultimately revealed that Epstein was the only passenger on board.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein was the only passenger on the flight being investigated, and the attempt to serve target letters was related to him.

persons.name: Martin Woods
persons.context: Woods conducted the investigation and attempted to delay Epstein's flight to serve target letters.

persons.name: Lee Duffy
persons.context: Duffy was contacted by Woods to discuss the possibility of delaying Epstein's flight.

persons.name: E.Y.
persons.context: E.Y. provided information about the flight status and the possibility of delaying it.

persons.name: Lynette Petty-Amey
persons.context: Petty-Amey was contacted by Woods to inform Customs and Border Patrol of his impending arrival at the airport.

persons.name: Richard Peak
persons.context: Peak met Woods at the airport to assist in checking the plane for the two female targets.

connections.description: Woods was investigating Epstein in relation to the attempt to serve target letters.
Peak, as a CBP supervisor, was involved in checking Epstein's plane during the investigation.
Woods and Peak worked together to check Epstein's plane and serve the target letters.
Woods contacted Petty-Amey for assistance in notifying Customs about his arrival.
Woods sought Duffy's assistance in delaying Epstein's flight.
E.Y. provided flight information regarding Epstein's plane.

events.title: Attempt to Serve Target Letters
events.description: An attempt was made to serve target letters to two females on Epstein's private plane at Cyril E. King Airport.

locations: Cyril E. King Airport, St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: The investigation involved an attempt to serve target letters to two females on Epstein's flight.
Epstein was the only passenger on the flight at the time of the investigation.
Coordination was required with multiple law enforcement agencies, including the FBI and Customs and Border Protection.
The flight was not delayed as the pilot did not request permission to take off.
There were two female targets mentioned, but their identities were redacted.
